intro: Tephrosia purpurea var. supina, commonly known as purple crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its upright, branching stem and clusters of small, showy purple to pink flowers. The leaves are pinnately compound, with slender, alternate leaflets that give the plant a delicate appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties and use in traditional herbal remedies.
